comment.author: 33102966@N06
comment._content: There are a lot of online photos of SS Zephyr at the State Library of Western Australia. I have found many newspaper references on the Trove website as well. Zephyr operated on the Swan River well into the late 1930s it would seem. As well as operating as an excursion ferry on the Swan, it also made regular trips to Rottnest Island. Remarkably in February 1908 there is a detailed account of an ocean excursion from Perth to Rockingham, which is some 45 km south of Perth on the coast trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/77335752

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33102966@N06] Thanks for the links & info! We've added it all to our collection records :)
